reviewText: I love OMD, and this DVD did not disapoint. It's great to hear them perform all the songs from "Architecture and Morality" after all those years, but the party really starts, once they start the second half of the set, including most of their big hit singles. The band sounds great, and the picture quality, and video editing of the performance are excellent.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was lucky enough to preview a couple of songs from this upcoming DVD, and all I can say is "WOW"! I can't wait for the DVD to see the rest of them. OMD has never sounded better. I never thought I'd see the day Paul and Andy would be back on stage together again. Hopefully a 2008 U.S. tour will follow. It was sad seeing OMD back in the early 90's without Paul. If you're an OMD fan, get this DVD as soon as it comes out.Edit 6/9/08: I contacted Eagle Rock Entertainment, and they are aware of the problem with mislabeled DVDs. The current DVDs are in fact PAL, and they they say they are correcting the problem. If you current DVD player can't play PAL disks, I would wait until the problem is fixed before ordering.
summary: Dream come true for die-hard OMD fans
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been an OMD fan since their first album (not CD!). I bought this and the re-issued Architecture and Morality CD that has the bonus DVD recorded in 1981. Both are great and you should buy them both. The most striking comparison is the crowd. The 1981 crowd is all young people. The crowd in this video is probably the same people only 26 years older. Still, two great videos! Oh, by the way, the DVD with the re-issued Architecture and Morality CD is clearly marked that it's in PAL format. I figured if anything it would play on my computer. I popped it into my blu-ray player and it played just fine!
Title: N/A

reviewText: What a great DVD.  Architecture and Morality plus a number of their hits.  Great sound, clear, good bottom end.  Video production is also first rate.  One if the few concert videos I can just and watch straight through.  If you like OMD, you cannot be without this video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow!  These guys are absolutely stunning live!  I did not expect this concert to be of this quality.  Who knew that these guys could play so well so many years after not playing together?  The band last played together in 1988.  This concert was filmed May 19, 2007 at Hammersmith Apollo, London.  Almost 20 years after last performing together the band has never sounded better!  Nearly every performance is flawless.  The production and stage presentation is spectacular!The sound quality is so amazing!  It is INCREDIBLE!  I cannot believe the sound that has been lifted from the performance!  The stereo mix is very well balanced, capturing the elements in a 2-channel format.  However, the *real* treat is the DTS Surround Sound mix.  Woah!!!  The drums are crisp, punchy, and clean.  The vocals of Andy and Paul soar.  The instruments come through loud and clear with clean separation.  Andy's lead vocals do come through the center channel!  The bass roars through the speakers and vibrates the surroundings.  The music has never sounded so wide and full.  I cannot recommend this enough for the surround sound mix!  The music is powerful and alive!Perhaps the reason that this music sounds so incredible is due to the age of the original recordings.  The original single and album recordings were previously only available in stereo format, not giving one the possibility of hearing the music in multiple channels.  The music produced in this concert uses modern technology, giving more warmth to the recordings.  The songs shine in a new light with their updated, modern productions and multi-channel audio option.As bonus features, the DVD includes alternate edits of "Maid Of Orleans" and "The New Stone Age".  Additionally, recent interviews with the band and Hambi Haralambous, the screen backdrop designer, are included.  Both interviews are informative and well worth watching.Orchestral Manoeuvres In The Dark [OMD].Live.Architecture & Morality & More.Recorded Live:  Saturday, 19th May 2007 - Hammersmith Apollo, London.Running Time:  136 minutes approx.DVD 9 - Dual Layer.16 : 9 Screen Format.Audio:  Dolby Digital Stereo, Dolby Digital 5.1, DTS Surround Sound.Region 0.  NTSC/PAL formats. 2008 Eagle Vision/Eagle Rock Entertainment.UPC: 8 01213 02429.My copy is an import.  Although this release is available in the U.S. I do not believe that Eagle Vision pressed the DVD in the U.S. but instead imported from Europe.Very highly recommended!  5/5.
summary: Incredible Performances!  Incredible Sound!  Incredible Band!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow! This is a stunner of a comeback concert. The sound is great. The visuals, done because Andy didn't think people would want to just watch old guys dance, are also great. Andy still dances just fine, too. Although Architecture and Morality is done in its entirety (not a bad thing) this only takes up about 40 minutes of the concert and so leaves about an hour of other material (Very minor quibble: Run time for the concert is one hour and 36 minutes for a total of 96 minutes - not 136 minutes as listed on the disc or the back of the case. Somebody doesn't realize one hour does NOT equal 100 minutes?) All bands should sound so good after not playing together for almost two decades. Also, IMHO, the music has aged well. Not so for Malcolm's waist nor Paul's vocals, but Humphries only sings lead on two of 22 songs so this is also a minor quibble. Andy's vocals and energy are spot on. This is a wonderful OMD DVD. So when is Organization & More DVD coming out?
Title: N/A

reviewText: How good it was to see and hear OMD again. Even with the so called unorthodox way their albums were recorded and the way the band came together they were a great live performing band even at outdoor concerts such as the EX's Bandshell. This only gives testimony that this is a group of talented musicians. An excellent concert. It makes you wonder though if they will still be able to create newer iteresting material.
Title: N/A
